result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua D. Laffin was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

records.addlTxt:
3:49 PM Defendant Joshua D. Laffin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Also calling 22TR1263,1265.
Defendant is in receipt of information, Court enters not guilty plea on behalf. 
Bail continued.  Def directed to contact ADA Sowinski.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua D. Laffin in court. Calling 22CF143, 22TR1263 & 22TR1265. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Detective/Luke Linsmeyer/sworn/direct by Defendant/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Sowinski. Laffin has no questions. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Bond continued. Sowinski has discovery to give to Defendant and is filing information. Defendant is directed to stop at DA's office to pickup information. adj. 03:17 PM
Arraignment scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua D. Laffin in court. Calling 22CF143, 22TR1263 & 22TR1265. Court review of case. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant states would like to represent self. Court reads on waiver of counsel - waiver free and voluntary. Defendant waives time limits. Court directs to make appointment with DA's office. Defendant questions bail return. Court explains. Bond continued. adj. 03:22 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua D. Laffin appeared by video, in custody. 
Also calling 22tr1263,1265
In receipt, right to counsel. 
Schiek to bail  -Court questions defendant.  Court sets $  bond
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
